pullRequest.title: allow to parameterize SSL_ENDPOINT_IDENTIFICATION_ALGORITHM_CONFIG
pullRequest.bodyText:
Type of change
Select the type of your PR

Bugfix
Enhancement / new feature

Description
allows to parameterize SSL_ENDPOINT_IDENTIFICATION_ALGORITHM_CONFIG="HTTPS" to allow untrusted certificates
Reason (from Confluent Documentation): ssl.endpoint.identification.algorithm The endpoint identification algorithm used by clients to validate server host name. The default value is https. Clients including client connections created by the broker for inter-broker communication verify that the broker host name matches the host name in the broker’s certificate. Disable server host name verification by setting to an empty string.
Checklist
Please go through this checklist and make sure all applicable tasks have been done

 Update/write design documentation in ./design
 Write tests
 Make sure all tests pass
 Update documentation
 Check RBAC rights for Kubernetes / OpenShift roles
 Try your changes from Pod inside your Kubernetes and OpenShift cluster, not just locally
 Reference relevant issue(s) and close them after merging
 Update CHANGELOG.md

nodes.bodyText: Do we need the _CONFIG at the end of the variable as well as value? None of the other options does have it, so I think it would be better to be consistent.
Same as above - do we need the the _CONFIG at the end? It is not used on the other fields.

commit.message:
allow to parameterize SSL_ENDPOINT_IDENTIFICATION_ALGORITHM_CONFIG="HTTPS" to allow untrusted certificates

Signed-off-by: Christian Schmitt <christian.schmitt@iunera.com>

cleanup \t and whitespaces

Signed-off-by: Christian Schmitt <christian.schmitt@iunera.com>
